      • compressionScan

        public java.lang.String compressionScan(char[][] buffer)

        Method for finding the optimal region dimensions to compress the buffer with

        Returns:

      • compressBuffer

        public java.lang.String compressBuffer(char[][] buffer,
                                       int height,
                                       int width)

        Method for converting the data stored in the buffer into a string containg a literally smaller amount of data

        The method iterates through the buffer converting areas of the buffer refered to as regions into comparable strings. Adjacent regions that are determined equal by region overlay comparison (ROC-equal) are counted. The equal regions can therefore be represented by a repeat of the region containing the most data.

        Parameters:
        buffer - Reference to the array to read
        height - Height of the region size
        width - Width of the region size
        Returns:
        The compressed form of the buffer with supplied height and width dimensions

      • printGraph

        public void printGraph(int size,
                       int labels)

        Prints the graph of the items added to the compression graph

        Parameters:
        size - Width of the graph in characters to fit the data onto
        labels - Number of labels along the axis

      • addGraphItem

        public void addGraphItem(int y,

        Adds correctly formatted item to the compression graph

        Parameters:

        x - Region Width
        size - Size of the compression with region dimensions y x
